properties.description: Ashfield Voluntary Action invites you to our Warm Welcome Activity Space. Social Groups run throughout the week and adults are welcome to join us. When the group ends our Warm Welcome doesn't. You can stay until 4pm and make use of the games, puzzles, and crafts or pick up a book and have a quiet read. The hot drinks trolley will be available for you to use. Bring some lunch with you or pop down to our kiosk in the main reception that offers hot and cold food at reasonable prices. For more information about our social groups please call 01623 555 551 or visit our website www.ashfieldvoluntaryaction.org.uk Please note we are unable to offer this service from Friday 22nd December 2023 until Monday 8th January 2024

properties.description: A small group of local people are volunteering and working exceptionally hard to set up a ‘Winter Warm Hub at Jacksdale Community Centre. This is going to be known as ‘The Community Kitchen’. This will be open each Tuesday morning from 11.00 am until 1.00pm, starting on 1st October 2024. The Community Kitchen is a not-for-profit venture and is being supported financially by donations and run by volunteers. ‘Everyone will be made very welcome. The heating will be on, so come along and join us for a light lunch and tea and coffee. Hopefully this small venture will be a huge success over the winter period and a great support to those who need it, right here in our community.

Over 30 activites and services. Refreshments available (donations).

Free Parking/Full Disabled Access /Free Wi-Fi

hours._text:
Monday - Thursdays, 9am - 3.45pm

properties.title: The Core Centre: Charity Hub & food pantry

Free tea, coffee and biscuits.
properties.title: Parkinson's Support Group

properties.address: Church Lane, Arnold, Nottingham, NG5 6HJ
properties.description:
Community Kitchen: A warm welcome and friendly chat is always available.

Seniors Tea: Games, Quizzes and Sing Along.

Community Cinema: Different film each month, chance to meet new people and watch a good old movie with friends.

All free, donations welcome.

hours._text:

Seniors' Tea: First Saturday of every month, 2.30-4.30pm. 

Community Cinema: Third Tuesday of every month, 7.30pm

Free toast for children up to the age of 16.

Newspapers, TVs, kids' corner, place for older kids to do homework. Rooms for older/elderly adults to socialise.

Staff and volunteers offer a friendly warm welcome, there is comfy seating and a range of resources to enjoy.

Free Wi-Fi, wheelchair-friendly access (inside and outside), Photocopying, Newspapers & magazines, Fax machine, Audio/talking books, Computers, Books.

hours._text:

Place of Welcome: Fridays, 10.30am-12pm.
